function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"The assumption that the room air is well mixed may not hold true in all situations, leading to inaccurate calculations of average particle residence time and irradiation flux.","Impact":"Inaccurate calculations may result in inadequate disinfection of the room, allowing for the propagation of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Conduct a thorough assessment of the room's ventilation system and airflow patterns to ensure that the assumption of well-mixed air is valid. Consider using computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations to model air circulation in the room.","Technologies":"Computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations","People":"Occupants of the room","Owner":"Building managers, ventilation system engineers"},{"Description":"Inaccurate adjustment of Z values for use with upper-room UVGI systems may lead to ineffective disinfection of microbes suspended in the air.","Impact":"Ineffective disinfection may allow for the survival and propagation of contagious microbes in the room.","Mitigation":"Carefully validate and calibrate the Z value adjustments for upper-room UVGI systems based on experimental data and conditions specific to the room.","Technologies":"Experimental validation equipment, data collection and analysis tools","People":"Microbiologists, UVGI system engineers","Owner":"Laboratory managers, UVGI system operators"},{"Description":"Incorrect computation of average irradiation flux may result in insufficient UVGI exposure to achieve the desired survival fraction of microbes.","Impact":"Insufficient UVGI exposure may lead to incomplete disinfection and allow for the persistence of contagious microbes in the room.","Mitigation":"Regularly monitor and calibrate UVGI systems to ensure that the computed average irradiation flux aligns with the desired survival fraction of microbes. Consider implementing real-time monitoring and feedback control systems for UVGI exposure.","Technologies":"UVGI system monitoring and control equipment","People":"Facility maintenance staff, UVGI system operators","Owner":"Facility managers, infection control personnel"}]}
